page.title: 17THE HORSE AND STAG INN
page.content: This is the oldest{public house in the village,and is hidden away down the Old Bawtry Road.You cannot pass it by accident,you either know it exists or you don't go at all. It is owned by{Bass Charrington, the national brewery,and its most popular selling drink is{Stones {bitter.}On an average it serves{40 {customers a day}with the busiest day being{Saturday.}The{publican}runs the pub with the help of his{wife,}and when they take a holiday the publicans 'inlaws' run the pub. The pub has a{piano}and a singing room where customers can go to have a drink and a{sing-a-long.}There is no other entertainment,nor does the pub serve food.
